results.title: Sunday Too Far Away
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Matt Carroll, Gil Brealey and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job - a group of shearers working on an outback station in 1955 in the months leading to the nine months shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual. Cinemaphotography by Geoff Burton. Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Hannam, Matt Carroll, Gil Brealey and South Australian Film Corporation
results.description:
One of the few Australian feature films in which the narrative is centred on the portrayal of workers on the job, tins this case a group of shearers working on an Outback station in 1955, in the months leading to the nine-month shearers’ strike. While the gun shearer played by Jack Thompson is the central character, the focus of this episodic and unsentimental drama is on the communal values of the group rather than on those of the individual.

Cinematography by Geoff Burton.

Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.

Cinematography by Geoff Burton.

Cast also includes Max Cullen, Peter Cummins, John Ewart, John Hargreaves, Sean Scully, Ken Shorter, Gregory Apps.

results.title: Exploring...immersive art pedagogy
results.creator_credit: Geraldine Burke, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Geraldine Burke’s addiction to daydreaming sometimes got her into trouble but also took her to many wonderful places. Eventually she found the thing that could bring her daydreams to life.

results.title: Sunday lark
results.creator_credit: Sanford Semel and Pathe Contemporary Films
results.brief_description: A lighthearted satire about the computers and gadgets of big business. When a small Chinese-American girl wanders into a modern office building on a Sunday her innocent delight in pressing buttons and using the gadgets creates such chaos that the guard calls for police reinforcements. As they arrive the little girl slips out of the building unnoticed.

results.title: Sunday father
results.creator_credit: Paul Leaf, Sheldon Satin, Films Incorporated and International Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the contemporary situation of a divorced man who takes his daughter on a once-a-week outing on Sunday afternoon. Focuses on the problem of a father trying to be friends with a little girl whom he sometimes feels barely knows him. Featuring Dustin Hoffman and Jane Schisgal with music and vocals by Janis Ian.

results.title: Putting people away
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Psychiatrists have the responsibility for deciding who should and who shouldn’t be locked away, whose behaviour is merely eccentric and who is in fact, mentally ill. This program looks at the effect on people’s civil liberties when they are forcibly detained and questions whether it is necessary for the mentally ill to be hospitalised at all.

results.title: Summing up
results.creator_credit: Bryan Bruty, Mark Hamlyn and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Huw Evan presents this final program in the series, in which experts with varying concerns and criticisms about the treatment of psychiatric disorders confront two psychiatrists. Each topic is illustrated by excerpts from the previous programs. Some of the issues discussed are the use of electro-convulsive therapy, treatment with drugs and enforced hospitalisation.

results.title: Schizophrenia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
The introduction of major psychotic drugs have meant that many schizophrenics can now lead normal lives in the community. These drugs however, can have severe side effects, and sometimes they can only limit the disease. This program looks at some typical case studies in schizophrenia and seeks out opinions on the use of drugs and other methods of treatment of this most frightening illness.

results.title: Getting anxious
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
Everyone suffers from anxiety occasionally but for 10% of the community anxiety can lead to helpless panic which prevents them from participating in everyday life. This program studies the effects of different types of panic disorders and, using interviews with patients, discusses the different types of treatment available.

results.title: Depression
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Barriers of the Mind”.
We all suffer low spirits occasionally, but when depression becomes a devastating illness it can be life threatening. This program looks at the way manic depressives cope with their illness, its causes and at the type of treatment which is available to them.
